section.name: Project Library
section.p: The DPML build system maintains information about projects, resources, and modules in a central library. The library is described using XML and is used to automate the determination of project BUILD, TEST and RUNTIME dependencies, project build prerequisites, processing requirements and associated properties.

subsection.name: library.xml
subsection.p: The library file is maintained in a file named library.xml. The file is located by searching up the directory hierachy from the current working directory to the root of the file system until the library source is located.
A library source file contains the declaration of project modules. In turn, modules contain declarations of available resources (such as dependent jar files), projects, and subsidiary modules.

tr.td: An set of global property declarations.
An set of imported module defintions.
An set of top-level module declarations.

section.name: Example
section.source:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?>
<library>
<properties> <property name="project.builder.uri" value="link:plugin:dpml/tools/dpml-tools-ant"/> </properties>
<imports> <import uri="link:module:junit"/> <import uri="link:module:ant"/> <import uri="link:module:jgoodies"/> </imports>
<modules>
<module name="dpml" basedir=".">
<types> <type id="module" alias="true"/> </types>
<properties> <property name="project.publisher.name" value="Digital Product Meta Library"/> <property name="project.specification.vendor" value="${project.publisher.name}"/> <property name="project.implementation.vendor" value="${project.publisher.name}"/> <property name="project.implementation.vendor-id" value="net.dpml"/> <property name="project.publisher.url" value="http://www.dpml.net"/> <property name="project.resource.host" value="http://repository.dpml.net"/> <property name="project.api.host" value="http://api.dpml.net"/> <property name="project.svn.host" value="svn://svn.berlios.de/dpml/trunk/main"/> </properties>
<module base="transit"/> <module base="tools"/> <module base="metro"/> <module base="depot"/> <module base="util"/>
<project name="central" basedir="central"/>
</module>
</modules>
</library>
section.p: The above library directive contains a collection of global properties and top-level modules. Collectively this information is sufficient to execute a complete preparation, compilation, packaging, testing, and installation of the project and modules defined within the library. This level of automation is achived through (a) support from the library for project relationship information, dependencies, properties and produced type declarations, combined with (b) a plugin build implementation.
